title: Do NOT buy this for use with a laptop or desktop computer
text: At home, I have a SoundBlock brand bluetooth speaker I bought in 2014. It is ugly. It cost about $40. It barely gives any bass at all. Yet somehow that thing is still making sounds like it always has. I hate it. I want it to die so I can be justified in purchasing something that sounds much better. I decided I wasn't going to wait for it to die and was going to find a better sound and put this awful speaker out to pasture.I did a fair amount of research before purchasing the Tribit MaxSound bluetooth speaker. I was considering the Minirig 3, but many online audio forums kept steering me towards purchasing this Tribit MaxSound. Everyone said 'it has an even sound' with 'the right amount of bass'. They wrote that 'it gets loud without distortion'. They said it 'holds its own against speakers twice it's price'. These are all flat lies. This speaker hisses when it connects via bluetooth to my phone. It has the same volume and sound quality as my old SoundBlock from 8 years ago.To make sure I wasn't insane, I played Nadia Boulanger's piano piece 'Vers la vie nouvelle', first on my kid's echo dot and then on this speaker. The Echo dot sounded like a Bowers & Wilkins bookshelf speaker compared to this trash. This is inexcusable for an audio company to be making speakers in 2021 with this low level of quality.

My old Sharkk speaker, that is about 3 years old, will go for days without charging. I wish to that the Sharkk was still available. Purchasing this speaker was a bad decision.

title: Don't believe any of the good reviews here!
text: I purchased this speaker for a white noise speaker during sleep (as well as listen to music & movies while awake). The device works fine except for the purpose for which it was purchased. Every night I have used the device, I get woken up at 3:30am due to the speaker saying "battery low" and then dying within 5 minutes. I turn the speaker off and it full charges with no other changes to the cable, plug-in, etc. I can't afford to lose sleep every night so I'm returning this device for one that will actually run off the power cable throughout the night. This speaker was worthless for my purpose but would likely work well for most others.
